elements.name: phq9>>>main
rows: Little interest or pleasure in doing things.
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless.
Trouble falling/staying asleep, sleeping too much.
Feeling tired or having little energy.
Poor appetite or overeating.
Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down.
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching TV.
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite; being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around more than usual.
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way.
elements.title: During the PAST 2 WEEKS, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

elements.name: gad7>>>main
elements.title: During the PAST 2 WEEKS, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?
rows: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Trouble relaxing
Being so restless that it's hard to sit still
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

elements.name: psychosis_abuse>>>psychosis
elements.title: Have you ever experienced symptoms of psychosis (e.g., hearing voices that other people could not hear; feeling that others could read your thoughts or that thoughts were being stolen from your mind; thinking there was a plot against you)?

elements.title: Have you ever felt that others could read your thoughts or that thoughts were being stolen from your mind?

elements.name: psychosis_abuse>>>paranoid
elements.title: Have you ever felt that there was a plot to harm you or that people were following you (that was not validated by friends or family members)?

elements.name: mindfulness_groups>>>comments
elements.title: Please add any further information or additional comments that could help us determine whether or not MBCT is for you.

choices.text: I verify that the above information, which I have provided for the purpose of enrollment in the Mindfulness-Based CognitiveTherapy Program, is accurate and true to the best of my knowledge. I am aware that this information will be used to evaluate my eligibility for the MBCT program and that my responses are confidential and will be viewed only by MBCT teachers (and administrative support staff as needed).

elements.name: mindfulness_groups>>>verify
elements.title: You must have a family physician and/or therapist while participating in the MBCT program. Please note that this workshop is not a substitute for individual therapy and we cannot assume responsibility for your care on an ongoing basis. Workshop facilitators are available by appointment outside of workshop hours, but are unable to provide emergency care. Participants are encouraged to have emergency psychosocial/medical care in place during the 8-week program.

elements.name: msi10>>>main
elements.title: Please answer the following 10 yes or no questions 'in general':
rows: Have any of your closest relationships been troubled by a lot of arguments or repeated breakups?s
Have you deliberately hurt yourself physically (e.g., punched yourself, cut yourself, burned yourself) or made a suicide attempt?
Have you had at least two other problems with impulsivity (e.g., eating binges and spending sprees, drinking too much and verbal outbursts)?
Have you been extremely moody?
Have you felt very angry a lot of the time. How about often acted in an angry or sarcastic manner?
Have you often been distrustful of other people?
Have you frequently felt unreal or as if things around you were unreal?
Have you chronically felt empty?
Have you often felt that you had no idea of who you are or that you have no identity?

Have you made desperate efforts to avoid feeling abandoned or being abandoned (e.g., repeatedly called someone to reassure yourself that he or she still cared, begged then not to leave you, clung to them physically)?

elements.name: pss10>>>main
elements.title: Please indicate the extent to which you have had the following experiences <u>in the past month</u>:
rows: In the last month, how often have you been upset because of something that happened unexpectedly?
In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?
In the last month, how often have you felt nervous and â€œstressedâ€?
In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?
In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?
In the last month, how often have you found that you could not cope with all the things that you had to do?
In the last month, how often have you been ableto control irritations in your life?
In the last month, how often have you felt that you were on top of things?
In the last month, how often have you been angered because of things that were outside of your control?
In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
